To help you find the **best Bluetooth speakers** with amazing sound and
excellent portability, we purchased and tested 30 different options over the
course of 25 hours. Once we received the speakers, we measured each option
based on its audio quality, sonic capabilities, durability and battery life.
We also rated speakers based on their water resistance capabilities and
Bluetooth range, among other features. Keep reading to learn more about the
Charge 4 and the other best Bluetooth speakers on our list.

## Top 10 Best Bluetooth Speakers

### **#1** JBL Charge 4 Bluetooth Speaker

Sale

[ ![Our #1 Pick is the JBL Charge 4 Bluetooth Speaker](//m.media-
amazon.com/images/I/41OQhXGVvYL.jpg)
](//www.amazon.com/dp/B07HKQ6YGX?tag=best-bluetooth-

Speaker")

[ Our #1 Pick is the JBL Charge 4 Bluetooth Speaker
](//www.amazon.com/dp/B07HKQ6YGX?tag=best-bluetooth-

_Award:_ **TOP PICK**

**WHY WE LIKE IT:** This JBL speaker sounds amazing, lasts forever and is
completely waterproof. If you’re looking for the best overall speaker
experience, this is the choice for you.

**Read Full Review** : [JBL Charge 4 Review](jbl-charge-4-review)

  

Pros

  

  * __Amazing, room-filling sound quality
  * __Stellar battery life
  * __IPX7 water resistance

Cons

  * __Heavier than other models
  * __Doesn’t offer 360-degree sound
  * __Takes longer to charge

  

JBL is one of the biggest names in the portable speaker world, and it’s easy
to see why with the JBL Charge 4. This powerful Bluetooth speaker offers some
incredible features. Weighing in at 3 pounds, it’s a little heavier than some
of the other choices on our list, but the added weight lends some extra
durability to the whole thing. It also features an IPX7 waterproof rating,
meaning it can be fully submerged in water without worry.

The Charge 4’s battery life is one of its best features, with an impressive
20+ hours on a single charge. You’ll also be impressed by the superb sound
quality that the Charge 4 offers. Its powerful bass and clear, crisp high
tones make for an enjoyable listening experience, whether inside by yourself
or outside at a pool party. And speaking of pool parties, the Charge speaker
can connect to up to 100 additional JBL speakers for the ultimate dance party.
The only thing we would love to see here is 360-degree sound, but you can
still achieve something similar by connecting multiple speakers.

_Award:_ **HONORABLE MENTION**

**WHY WE LIKE IT:** A small, yet powerful Bluetooth speaker offers a rich
audio experience at an affordable entry point. It’s also splash resistant and
durable enough to take a drop or two.

  

Pros

  

  * __Rich audio in a small package
  * __Stellar, 30-hour battery life
  * __IPX5 water resistance

Cons

  * __Lack of premium features
  * __Some connection drops

  

The OontZ Angle 3 strays away from the traditional cylindrical Bluetooth
speaker design. Instead, it stays true to its name with its pyramidal design
that’s more stable on a greater variety of surfaces. Other than this angular
design, though, the OontZ is a fairly simple, unassuming speaker without the
extra bells and whistles you might find on other, more expensive speakers.

Don’t let the Angle 3’s otherwise simple design trick you into thinking it
offers simple audio quality, though. We were impressed with the rich sound
such a small speaker could create. The speaker is loud, and the sound you get
stays clear and undistorted. The small size does mean a shorter battery life,
however, clocking in at just 8 hours. In the end, though, this is a small
price to pay for such a high-quality and affordable Bluetooth speaker.

[Check Price](//www.amazon.com/dp/B01HETFQKS?tag=best-bluetooth-
speaker-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1 "Check Price")

_Award:_ **MOST PORTABLE**

**WHY WE LIKE IT:** This compact Bose is extra portable, rugged and simple to
operate. On top of all that, you get that traditional Bose audio quality,
which is always a good thing.

**Read Full Review** : [Bose SoundLink Mini II Review](bose-soundlink-mini-ii-
review)

  

Pros

  

  * __IPX4 water resistance
  * __Well-balanced, rich sound quality
  * __More portable than others

Cons

  * __Weak bass
  * __No AC adapter included
  * __Disappointing battery life

  

As with other Bose speakers, the SoundLink Color II offers strong audio
performance with crisp highs and decent lows. The bass is a little weak here,
but that’s to be expected with such a small speaker. However, this small
speaker can still pack a punch, and there’s minimal distortion at higher
volumes. You also get a built-in microphone so you can use speakerphone
functionality with your connected smartphone.

We were very appreciative of the SoundLink’s compact and portable design.
Measuring in at just 2 inches thick and 5 inches tall and wide, this Bose
speaker is one of the smallest options on our list. Despite that small size,
the Bose is surprisingly rugged. It features a shock-absorbent silicone
exterior that’s also easy to grip on the go. It’s also resistant to water
splashes with an IPX4 rating. We do wish the battery offered a little more
than 8 hours of continuous playtime, but it can be quickly charged.

_Award:_ **BEST CONNECTION RANGE**

**WHY WE LIKE IT:** A super light and extra portable speaker, without
sacrificing on sound quality. It also offers a full 24 hours of battery life
for extended listening and an impressive 66-foot Bluetooth range.

**Read Full Review** : [Anker Soundcore Review](anker-soundcore-review)

  

Pros

  

  * __Amazing 24-hour battery life
  * __Compact, yet rugged build
  * __Impressively loud

Cons

  * __Not waterproof
  * __Some speakerphone echo

  

You may be surprised at just how much of a punch the Anker Soundcore Bluetooth
speaker packs, especially considering its size. It’s one of the smallest
options on our list, but that doesn’t mean it sacrifices on overall sound
quality. From the moment you turn it on and start jamming, you’ll notice just
how clear and well-balanced the audio is. It can also get incredibly loud for
such a small speaker.

The Anker’s battery life is also something worth noting. Clocking in at around
24 hours, this is one of the more impressive batteries on our list. You also
get a good level of durability with the Anker Soundcore. It can withstand
drops from various heights and, when combined with its compact design, it’s
the perfect on-the-go speaker. Unfortunately, it’s not waterproof, so you’ll
want to keep this one away from the pool. All in all, though, the Anker
Soundcore is very affordable, meaning you get a ton of value with your
purchase here.

_Award:_ **MOST USER FRIENDLY**

**WHY WE LIKE IT:** With innovative capacitive touch controls, loud volume,
and extra-long battery life, this speaker is an excellent option for anyone
that wants an excellent all-around music player.

  

Pros

  

  * __Innovative touch controls
  * __Overall balanced sound quality
  * __Impressive 20-hour battery

Cons

  * __No water resistance
  * __Top can scratch easily

  

The DOSS Soundbox Touch’s best feature is alluded to in its name. Where other
Bluetooth speakers feature physical buttons, the DOSS features an innovative
capacitive touch control panel on top of the speaker. This touch panel is
intuitive and incredibly easy to use, making this one of the most user-
friendly Bluetooth speakers on our list. Just be aware that the touch control
panel can scratch easily, so be careful when carrying it around with you.

On top of the touch control panel, the DOSS Soundbox Touch is designed well,
although it isn’t as rugged as other options, especially since it isn’t water-
resistant. However, it offers a sleek and attractive design that looks good
anywhere you place it. You can also purchase it in several different colors.
We were most impressed, however, with the Soundbox’s battery life at 20 hours.
The audio is well balanced overall, and the speaker gets impressively loud in
spite of its compact size.

[ ![Our #6 Pick is the Bugani M83 Bluetooth Speaker](//m.media-

_Award:_ **LOUDEST VOLUME**

**WHY WE LIKE IT:** There’s a lot to love about this speaker, including its
super tough design, incredibly loud volume, and amazing battery life. This
speaker is also packed with premium features for an even better audio
experience, both indoors and outdoors.

  

Pros

  

  * __2x 20-watts of power
  * __Extra rugged design
  * __Packed with premium features

Cons

  * __Large and heavy

  

The Bugani M83 Bluetooth speaker is the largest option on our list, but that
also means it’s the loudest. If you’re looking for a speaker that can output
some serious volume without audio distortion, look no further. The M83 offers
a total of 40 watts of power between its two main drivers. And while the
volume is certainly a plus, you also get amazing sound quality from the M83.
It performs best with bass, which is rich and powerful, but it’s mid-ranges
and high tones are clear as well.

The Bugani also excels in its design. This is both an indoor and outdoor
Bluetooth speaker with its IPX5 water resistance rating. It’s also incredibly
rugged, with durable rubber housing that can take a hit or two without worry.
Yes, the large and rugged design makes the Bugani heavier than other options,
but it also includes a useful carrying handle to make transport easier. The
Bugani also includes tons of premium features, like Bluetooth 5.0 for more
stable connection, an incredible 30-hour battery life, MicroSD slot and an
enhanced internal antenna for a 66-foot Bluetooth range.

_Award:_ **BEST IP67 RATED**

**WHY WE LIKE IT:** This UE Bluetooth speaker is loud, extremely rugged and
completely waterproof. If you’re looking for something you can truly take
anywhere with you, this is your best choice.

**Read Full Review** : [UE Boom 3 Review](ue-boom-3-review)

  

Pros

  

  * __Room filling 360 degree sound
  * __Powerful, rich sound
  * __Adaptive and custom equalizer functionality

Cons

  * __Charging dock sold separately
  * __Audio lacks some clarity

  

One of the best features about the Ultimate Ears Boom 3 speaker is that it’s
completely waterproof. With an IP67 rating, the speaker can take a complete
dip into the water for up to 30 minutes without worry. Plus, it even floats,
so you won’t lose it to the depths. The UE Boom 3 is also nearly
indestructible with an incredibly rugged design that can handle drops from
tall heights and thousands of button presses over the speaker’s life. That
IP67 rating also means its dustproof, which is a nice bonus.

When it comes to audio quality, the UE Boom features cutting-edge 360 degree
sound, which creates a more immersive listening experience, no matter where
you are in relation to the speaker. We do wish it offered a little more
clarity, but the bass is powerful and rich. It makes up for the lack of
clarity with excellent equalizer functionality that gives you more control
over the sound. The Boom 3 also gives you 15 hours of battery life for more
extended listening sessions.

## Best Bluetooth Speaker Buyer’s Guide

### The Most Important Features to Consider

  1. **Audio Quality**  
As with any audio product, the sound quality your Bluetooth speakers produce
is one of the first things you should consider when making a new purchase. Of
course, audio quality can be somewhat of a subjective thing, especially when
some speakers are better than others in different situations. If you’re
looking to purchase the best outdoor Bluetooth speaker, then you’ll want
something with huge amounts of volume. Or, if you want the best indoor
Bluetooth speaker, you’ll want something that focuses on producing rich lows
and crisp highs so you can really hear the music the way the musicians
intended it.

  2. **Portability**  
Bluetooth speakers are the best portable speakers around, so it’s important
that you find an option you can easily move around the house or take along
with you as you travel. When it comes to portability, consider how heavy the
Bluetooth speaker is along with its overall size. If you purchase a large
Bluetooth speaker, you’ll want to be sure it includes some kind of carrying
handle to make it easier to take with you.

  3. **Water Resistance and Durability**  
Many Bluetooth speakers are now water resistant, and if you’re planning on
playing music by the pool or while you’re camping, this is an absolute must-
have feature. Water resistance is measured using an Ingress Protection, or IP,
rating. When you see this rating, it will usually look something like IP65 or
IPX4. The first digit indicates the level of protection against the ingress of
solids, while the second digit measures against liquids. The higher the number
here, the better. For use by the pool, we recommend purchasing a Bluetooth
speaker with at least an IPX4 rating, which protects against splashed water
from any direction. However, if you’re worried about the speaker falling in
the water, you’ll need to get something IPX7 or higher. You’ll also want a
Bluetooth speaker that can handle a few drops and bumps without being damaged
past the point of functioning. Since you’re likely going to carry your speaker
around with you, consider an option that provides some durability features
like rubber edges or completely drop-proof casing.

  4. **Battery Life**  
Due to the portable nature of Bluetooth speakers, you’ll want to be sure you
get something with a long-lasting battery, especially if you’re going to be
away from an outlet for a while. Battery life can vary greatly depending on
how you use the speaker. For example, playing music at max volume for long
periods of time is going to deplete your battery much faster. Also, larger
speakers tend to have larger batteries. Consider how often you’ll want to use
your speaker away from a place you can charge it and base your battery life
needs off of that.

  5. **Wireless Range**  
How far away can your phone be from the speaker you purchase? This is
important, especially if you’re in a big house or at a party with a ton of
people. Most Bluetooth connections offer a maximum range of around 33 feet,
but there are some Bluetooth speakers that offer more or less.

So, what is Bluetooth speaker?

Just like the name suggests, Bluetooth Speakers are digital audio receivers
(speakers) that rely on Bluetooth technology to receive sound from other
devices for playback. These speakers have a built-in amplifier that allows
magnification of the digital sound signals upon transmission from your smart
device without the need for plug-in or cable attachments. In essence,
Bluetooth is a wireless technology whereby two devices communicate with each
other, one as the signal transmitter and the other a receiver. These speakers
are well designed to be portable, utilize rechargeable batteries and have over
the past few years gained much popularity among lovers of music.
